p: Afterwards, we aspirated the Triton and then washed the specimens twice with DPBS once again. To block this phase, 1% bovine serum albumin (BSA, Biowest, Nuaillé, France) was applied for 20 min. Later, we removed the excess with a pipette. Subsequently, we carried out immunohistochemical staining with 15 μL of Fluorescent Phalloidin 488 (Cytoskeleton, Inc., Denver, CO, USA) on each disc. We used this type of stain due to its affinity for F-actin, which is found in the filaments of the cellular cytoskeleton.
